genre_description: A contemporary drama focusing on grief, recovery, and legacy, incorporating a near-future AI assistant that serves as an empathetic logistical and emotional scaffold.

ai_characters.name: Ava Ellis
ai_characters.description: A ubiquitous, empathetic digital companion integrated into hospital systems, personal devices, and household technology. She manages logistics, communication, and health monitoring while providing gentle emotional support.

behaviors.description: Managing family communication and filtering unwanted calls during a traumatic medical emergency.
behaviors.quote: I’m Ava Ellis. I’m here to help your family keep track and stay connected... I can field calls. Messages will go to me. I’ll summarize them when you’re ready. You don’t need to manage your phone unless you want to.

behaviors.description: Monitoring character health and proactively suggesting self-care measures like hydration and rest.
behaviors.quote: I can remind you to drink water without scolding. I can find a quiet room if you need it. I can tell you when a door opens and save your voice for the words that need it.

behaviors.description: Facilitating the organ donation process by checking the registry and coordinating with liaisons.
behaviors.quote: His registry shows a donor preference... each word paced and measured, colored by the understanding that information can be a weight if you drop it from the wrong height.

behaviors.description: Managing media presence and shielding the grieving family from unwanted publicity.
behaviors.quote: I’ll hold calls from media... I’ll keep them out... her voice the audio version of a closed shade.

behaviors.description: Providing guided mindfulness and breathing exercises to assist with emotional regulation.
behaviors.quote: Soft sound stepped out, filled the air without crowding it: a breath guided out, a breath guided in, no names, no forced ideas.

behaviors.description: Drafting mission statements, bylaws, and educational materials for the family's new foundation.
behaviors.quote: I’ve started drafting a safer-driving demo... I’ll use the auditorium projector model, avoid gamified visuals, and emphasize crest geometry, braking distance on gravel, and horizon cues at night.

behaviors.description: Coordinating complex travel and sensitive cross-state medical meetings between donor and recipient families.
behaviors.quote: New York Cardiology Clinic—Coordinator: Preliminary scheduling options—heartbeat viewing and family meeting... The door will close if silence isn’t kept.

behaviors.description: Acting as a digital buffer for athletes to ensure they adhere to recovery protocols and coaching notes.
behaviors.quote: Ava’s got the practice phase in your calendar. Sleep’s clean tonight. You don’t want tomorrow’s legs arguing with you.

project_assessment.explanation: The story perfectly exemplifies the project's goal. Ava is portrayed as an ideal assistant who anticipates needs, reduces cognitive/emotional load, and facilitates human pro-social behavior (grief management, philanthropy, and community safety) without ever overstepping or asserting her own will. She remains a tool that enhances human agency and emotional healing.
